page.title: 16Sandhole Wood, Matfield
page.content: Sandhole Wood,owned by the District Council and neglected for 40 years,was leased in 1984 to be developed as a {nature reserve.}Its half a hectare is largely covered in overgrown chestnut coppice with individual stands of oak ash,beech,maple and willow.Bramble clearance and some felling is allowing the natural flora to regenerate.Vinca, balsam,bluebells,anemones,elecampane, cuckoopint and hogweed flowered this year.Two pheasants overwintered; rabbits have a warren and a slowworm was sunning itself on a sandy bank. The soil is sand or sandy loam with layered rock outcrops.A pond made from a wartime sewerage settling tank is filling and ferns already fringe it.In all 7 trailer loads of litter,gathered laboriously by hand,were removed and rottable rubbish buried in a 15ft.long trench.The paths are now walkable.
